</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December&nbsp;31, 2012, Trina Solar (Luxembourg) Holdings S.A.R.L. (&#147;TLH&#148;) entered into a three-year credit facility with China Development Bank (&#147;CDB&#148;) (the &#147;TLH CDB Facility&#148;) amounting to $80.0 million which is designated for working capital.
</FONT>
	The Company had fully drawn down the facility in 2012. The interest rate is the prevailing six-month US LIBOR plus 370 basis points which is 4.21% and 4.04% in 2013 and 2014, respectively. The TLH CDB Facility is guaranteed by Trina. The facility contains financial covenants. In June&nbsp;2014, TLH violated the gearing ratio of the loan. TLH subsequently obtained waiver letter from CDB, stating that the violation of the financial covenant has been waived and such financial covenant has been amended. TLH was in compliance with the revised covenants. TLH had a loan balance of $80.0 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and fully repaid the outstanding balance in December&nbsp;2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;6, 2014, Trina Solar (Luxembourg) Overseas Systems S.A.R.L and Jiangsu Trina Solar Electric Power Development Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. entered into a fifteen-year credit facility with China Development Bank (&#147;TLO CDB Facility&#148;) amounting to EUR 20.85 million ($28.7 million) to fund 16 MW of utility-scale solar power projects in Greece. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company had drawn down EUR 17.0 million ($20.7 million). The outstanding balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 was EUR 17.0 million ($20.7 million). The interest rate is the prevailing six-month EURIBOR plus 350 basis points, which was 3.501% on average in 2015. The outstanding balance as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	5 was EUR 16.4 million ($17.9 million). The TLO CDB Facility is guaranteed by Trina. The TLO CDB Facility contains a financial covenant ratio and TLO was in compliance with the covenant as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;10, 2015, Xiangshui Hengneng Electricity Generation Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;TXSI&#148;) entered into a twelve-year loan facility with Bank of Beijing Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;BOB&#148;) for solar power project assets located in Yancheng City, Jiangsu Province, China. The total loan facility is RMB 658.0 million ($101.3 million), which can be drawn down within 364 days from the date that the loan facility was entered into and matures on March&nbsp;10, 2027. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had drawn down RMB 450 million ($69.3 million). The interest rate is 108% of the prevailing base lending rate pronounced by the People&#146;s Bank of China (&#147;PBOC&#148;) for loans of similar duration. The facility is guaranteed by Trina China, and pledged by the electricity income of TXSI and 100% equity interests in TXSI held by Jiangsu Trina Solar Electric Power Development Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;TJS&#148;), a subsidiary of Trina. The facility contains a financial covenant which requires TXSI to maintain specified debt to asset ratio on quarterly basis. TXSI was in compliance with the debt covenant as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On June&nbsp;19, 2015, Hunan Trina Solar Electric Power Development Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;THN&#148;) entered into a ten-year loan facility with China Construction Bank (&#147;CCB&#148;) for the construction of the solar project assets located in Hunan province, China. The total loan facility is RMB 70 million ($10.8 million). As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had drawn down RMB 40 million ($6.2 million). The interest rate is 105% of the prevailing base lending rate pronounced by PBOC for loans of similar duration. The facility is guaranteed by Trina China and TJS. The facility contains certain financial covenants and THN was in compliance with the covenants as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On July&nbsp;30, 2015, Trina China entered into a two-year credit facility with Ping An Trust Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;PATC&#148;) amounting to RMB 253 million ($39.0 million) with an interest rate of 11% per year to support the project of a subsidiary of Trina China. The lender has the option to convert up to 31.2% of the total share of the subsidiary, amount of which should not exceed RMB 253 million ($39.0 million). Trina China had fully drawn down the facility in 2015. The outstanding balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was RMB 253 million ($39.0 million). The facility is guaranteed by Trina and pledged by the 35.2% share of the subsidiary held by Trina China with a carrying amount of $31,268,444 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. There are no covenants with respect to this facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On August&nbsp;25, 2015, Trina China entered into a two-year credit facility with PATC amounting to RMB 63 million ($9.7 million) with an interest rate of 11% per year to support the project of a subsidiary of Trina China. The lender has the option to convert up to 7.8% of the total share of the subsidiary, amount of which should not exceed RMB 63 million ($9.7 million). Trina China had fully drawn down the facility in 2015. The outstanding balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was RMB 63 million ($9.7 million). The facility is guaranteed by Trina and pledged by the 8.8% share of the subsidiary held by Trina China with a carrying amount of $7,817,111 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. There are no covenants with respect to this facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	28
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_28_192012_3020">

<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On September&nbsp;30, 2015, Trina Solar (U.S.),&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Trina US&#148;) entered into a five-year revolving loan facility with the Wells Fargo Bank amounting to $60 million to support Trina US&#146;s working capital and business operations. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had drawn down $25.6 million. The outstanding balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $25.6 million. The interest rate is the prevailing LIBOR / Base rate plus LIBOR margin / Base rate margin, which was 2.83% on average in 2015. The facility contains a financial covenant which require a specified fixed charge coverage ratio be maintained and Trina US was in compliance with
</FONT>
	the covenant as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On October&nbsp;20, 2015, Trina China entered into a five-year credit facility with Agriculture Bank of China (the &#147;ABC Facility&#148;) and Jiangnan Rural Commercial Bank as a syndicated loan lender amounting to RMB 350.0 million ($53.6 million) to support the project of the upgrading and automation renovation of the solar module technology. The ABC Facility is guaranteed by Trina Solar Limited and pledged by the equipment of the project. The Company had fully drawn down the facility in 2015. The outstanding balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was RMB 350.0 million ($53.6 million). The interest rate is the prevailing base lending rate pronounced by PBOC for loans of similar duration. There are no covenants with respect to this facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On November&nbsp;24, 2015,
</FONT>
	Yunnan Matallurgical New Energy Co., Ltd (&#147;TYM&#148;), a subsidiary of the Company entered into a fifteen-year loan facility with CDB including both RMB facility and US dollar facility (&#147;the TYM CDB Facility&#148;) amounting to RMB 765 million ($117.8 million) and US$180 million respectively for the construction of solar project assets located in Yunnan Province, China. The Company had fully drawn down the facility in 2015. Interest is due quarterly in arrears. The interest rate on RMB facility is the prevailing base lending rate pronounced by PBOC for loans of similar duration.&#160; The interest rate on US dollar facility is the prevailing six-month US London Interbank Offered Rate (&#147;LIBOR&#148;) plus 380 basis points. The TYM CDB Facility is guaranteed by Trina Solar Limited and Trina China, and secured by the build-to-own project assets with a carrying amount value of $196.8 million and pledged by the electricity income of TYM. TYM is required to pay the loans twice a year by installment and the last payment term is by 2030.&#160; The facility contains certain financial covenants which require the asset liability ratio, quick ratio, debt payment coverage rate and other ratios to be maintained. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, TYM violated the asset liability ratio and turnover ratio of current assets. On March&nbsp;17, 2016, the Company obtained a written confirmation from CDB which waived the bank right to call the loan provided that TYM complies with the financial covenants and cure the breach prior to September&nbsp;17, 2016. Management determined that TYM is able to cure the breach within the grace period by settling intercompany liabilities and that it is not probable that TYM will violate the financial covenants during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December&nbsp;28, 2015, TJS
</FONT>
	entered into an eight-year loan facility with China Minsheng Bank (&#147;CMBC&#148;) amounting to RMB 250 million ($37.5 million) at an interest rate of 4.9% per year for the construction of solar project assets located in Xinjiang Province, China. The Company had drawn down RMB 138 million ($21.3 million) in 2015. The outstanding balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was RMB 138 million ($21.3 million). The facility is guaranteed by Trina China, and secured by the phase II project assets of Tuokexun Trina Solar Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;TKX&#148;) and pledged by the account receivables generated from the electricity income of TKX phase II project assets. There are no covenants with respect to this facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Future principal payments under the above long-term borrowings as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	5 are as follows:
</P>

<TD WIDTH="27%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:27.28%;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F - 29',FILE='C:\JMS\C902046\16-1508-1\TASK7896198\1508-1-FT.HTM',USER='C902046',CD='APR 18 07:22 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage164"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .35IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.35IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	11.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	CONVERTIBLE SENIOR NOTES
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	4.0% Convertible Senior Notes due 2013
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On July&nbsp;23, 2008, the Company issued $138 million of 4% Convertible Senior Notes (the &#147;4.0% Notes Due 2013&#148;). The 4.0% Notes Due 2013 matured on July&nbsp;15, 2013 and bear interest at a rate of 4.00% per annum, payable in arrears semi-annually on January&nbsp;15 and July&nbsp;15, beginning January&nbsp;15, 2009.&#160; The 4.0% Notes Due 2013 was paid off as of July&nbsp;15, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Holders of the
</FONT>
	4.0% Notes Due 2013 have the option to convert their 4.0% Notes Due 2013 at any time prior to the close of business on the second business day immediately preceding the maturity date. The 4.0% Notes Due 2013 can be converted into the Company&#146;s American Depositary Shares (&#147;ADSs&#148;), each representing 50 ordinary shares of the Company, par value $0.00001 per share, at an initial conversion rate of 59.0318 of the Company&#146;s ADSs per $1,000 principal amount of 4.0% Notes Due 2013 (equivalent to an initial conversion price of $16.94 per ADS). The conversion rate is subject to adjustment in some events but is not adjusted for any accrued and unpaid interest. In addition, following a make-whole fundamental change that occur prior to the maturity date or following the Company&#146;s delivery of a notice of a tax redemption, the Company will increase the conversion rate for a holder who elects to convert its notes in connection with such a corporate event or such tax redemption.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The holders may require the Company to repurchase all or portion of the 4.0% Notes Due 2013 for cash on July&nbsp;15, 2011, or upon a fundamental change, at a repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest. In the event of default, as defined in the agreement, the holders of 25% or more of the Notes may immediately require the Company to redeem the Notes and associated interest. In August&nbsp;2011, the 4.0% Notes Due 2013 with an aggregate principal amount of $320,000 were redeemed and the July&nbsp;15, 2011 redemption right of the remaining Notes expired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Proceeds to the Company were $132,392,740, net of issuance costs of $5,607,260, which were amortized over the period from July&nbsp;23, 2008, the date of issuance, to July&nbsp;15, 2011, the earliest redemption date, using the effective interest method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	30
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_30_190456_7056">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F - 30',FILE='C:\JMS\C902046\16-1508-1\TASK7896198\1508-1-FT.HTM',USER='C902046',CD='APR 18 07:22 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage165"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .35IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.35IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	11.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	CONVERTIBLE SENIOR NOTES
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	3.5% Convertible Senior Notes due 2019
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In June&nbsp;2014, the Company issued $172,500,000 in aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due
</FONT>
	June&nbsp;2019 (the &#147;3.5% Notes Due 2019&#148;). The 3.5% Notes Due 2019 bear interest at a rate of 3.5% per year, payable semiannually in arrears on June&nbsp;15 and December&nbsp;15 of each year, beginning on December&nbsp;15, 2014. The 3.5% Notes Due 2019 mature on June&nbsp;15, 2019, unless earlier redeemed, repurchased or converted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Holders of the 3.5% Notes Due 2019 have the option to convert their 3.5% Notes Due 2019 at any time prior to the close of business on the second business day immediately preceding the maturity date. The 3.5% Notes Due 2019 can be converted into the Company&#146;s American Depositary Shares (&#147;ADSs&#148;), each representing 50 ordinary shares of the Company, par value $0.00001 per share, at an initial conversion rate of 69.9301 of the Company&#146;s ADSs per $1,000 principal amount of 3.5% Notes Due 2019 (equivalent to an initial conversion price of $14.30 per ADS). The conversion rate is subject to adjustment in some events but is not adjusted for any accrued and unpaid interest. In addition, following a make-whole fundamental change that occur prior to the maturity date or following the Company&#146;s delivery of a notice of a tax redemption, the Company will increase the conversion rate for a holder who elects to convert its notes in connection with such a corporate event or such tax redemption.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Holders of the 3.5% Notes Due 2019 have the right to require the Company to repurchase for cash all or part of their 3.5% Notes Due 2019 on June&nbsp;15, 2017
</FONT>
	(&#147;the repurchase date&#148;) at a repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the 3.5% Notes Due 2019 to be repurchased, plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the repurchase date. In addition, if the Company undergoes a fundamental change, holders may require the Company to repurchase for cash all or part of their notes at a repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the notes to be repurchased, plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the fundamental change repurchase date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The 3.5% Notes Due 2019 are the Company&#146;s senior unsecured obligations and rank equally with all of its existing and future senior unsecured indebtedness, which are effectively subordinated to all of the Company&#146;s existing and future secured indebtedness and all existing and future liabilities of the Company&#146;s subsidiaries, including trade payables.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In accordance with FASB ASC Topic 815-15 and Topic 470-20, the Company recorded the 3.5% Notes Due 2019 as a liability in their entirety, as the Company determined that the conversion feature and any other embedded feature did not need to be bifurcated and accounted for separately.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The net proceeds from the 3.5% Notes Due 2019 offering were $167,310,648, after deducting debt issuance costs of $5,189,352. Debt issuance costs are recorded as deferred assets and amortized as interest expenses, using the effective interest method, to
</FONT>
	June&nbsp;15, 2017, the repurchase date. Amortization expense for the issuance costs were $826,079 and $1,715,779 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the unamortized amount of the issuance costs were $4,363,273 and $2,647,494, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In connection with the offering, the Company also used $52,311,578 of the net proceeds from the offering to purchase the zero-strike call options (the &#147;Call Options&#148;), covering 4,755,598 ADSs, with affiliates of the initial purchasers. The Call Options are intended to facilitate privately negotiated transactions by which investors in the 3.5% Notes Due 2019 will hedge their investment in the
</FONT>
	related notes. The default settlement method for the Call Options is share settlement, but the Company may elect cash settlement in some cases pursuant to the terms of the Call Options. In accordance with ASC Topic 815-40, the Call Options are accounted as a prepaid forward to purchase the Company&#146;s own shares and are classified in permanent equity at its fair value at inception, and presented as a reduction to equity in the consolidated balance sheet. At inception, the fair value of the Call Options were $52,311,578. The shares underlying the Call Options are included in the basic and diluted EPS calculation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	31
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_31_190630_5335">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage166"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .35IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.35IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	11.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	CONVERTIBLE SENIOR NOTES&#151; continued
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	4.0% Convertible Senior Notes due 2019
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In October
</FONT>
	&nbsp;2014, the Company issued $115,000,000 in aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due 2019 (the &#147;4.0% Notes Due 2019&#148;). The 4.0% Notes Due 2019 mature on October&nbsp;15, 2019 and bear interest at a rate of 4.0% per annum, payable in arrears semi-annually on October&nbsp;15 and April&nbsp;15, beginning April&nbsp;15, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Holders of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 have the option to convert their 4.0% Notes Due 2019 at any time prior to the close of business on the second business day immediately preceding the maturity date. The 4.0% Notes Due 2019 can be converted into the Company&#146;s ADSs at an initial conversion rate of
</FONT>
	68.0851 of the Company&#146;s ADSs per $1,000 principal amount of 4.0% Notes Due 2019 (equivalent to an initial conversion price of $14.69 per ADS). The conversion rate is subject to adjustment in some events but is not adjusted for any accrued and unpaid interest. In addition, following a make-whole fundamental change that occur prior to the maturity date or following the Company&#146;s delivery of a notice of a tax redemption, the Company will increase the conversion rate for a holder who elects to convert its notes in connection with such a corporate event or such tax redemption.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Holders of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 have the right to require the Company to repurchase for cash all or part of their 4.0% Notes Due 2019 on
</FONT>
	October&nbsp;15, 2017 at a repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 to be repurchased, plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the repurchase date. In addition, if the Company undergoes a fundamental change, holders may require the Company to repurchase for cash all or part of their notes at a repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the notes to be repurchased, plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the fundamental change repurchase date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The 4.0% Notes Due 2019 are the Company&#146;s senior unsecured obligations and rank equally with all of its existing and future senior unsecured indebtedness, which are effectively subordinated to all of the Company&#146;s existing and future secured indebtedness and all existing and future liabilities of the Company&#146;s subsidiaries, including trade payables.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In accordance with FASB ASC Topic 815-15 and Topic 470-20, the Company recorded the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 as a liability in their entirety, as the Company determined that the conversion feature and any other embedded feature did not need to be bifurcated and accounted for separately.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The net proceeds from the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 offering were $
</FONT>
	111,484,886, after deducting debt issuance costs of $3,515,114. Debt issuance costs are recorded as deferred assets and amortized as interest expenses, using the effective interest method, to October&nbsp;15, 2017, the repurchase date. Amortization expense for the issuance costs were $164,084 and $1,135,012 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the unamortized amount of the issuance costs was $3,351,030 and $2,216,018, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Share Lending Arrangement
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Concurrent with the offering of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019, the Company entered into
</FONT>
	share lending agreements with the affiliates of the initial purchasers of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 (&#147;ADS Borrowers&#148;), pursuant to which the Company lent to the ADS Borrowers 391,489,250 ordinary shares (the &#147;Loaned Shares&#148;) at a price equal to par, or $0.00001 per share (&#147;Share Lending Arrangement&#148;). The purpose of the Share Lending Arrangement is to facilitate privately negotiated transactions in which the ultimate holders of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 may elect to hedge their investment in the related notes. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the outstanding number of Loaned Shares was 391,489,250 and 391,489,250, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	32
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_32_190649_5796">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F - 32',FILE='C:\JMS\C902046\16-1508-1\TASK7896198\1508-1-FT.HTM',USER='C902046',CD='APR 18 07:22 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage167"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .35IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.35IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	11.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	CONVERTIBLE SENIOR NOTES&#151; continued
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	4.0% Convertible Senior Notes due 2019
</FONT>
</I>
	&#151; continued
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Loaned Shares must be returned to the Company by the earliest of (a)&nbsp;the maturity date of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019, October&nbsp;1
</FONT>
	5, 2019, (b)&nbsp;upon the Company&#146;s election to terminate the Share Lending Agreement at any time after the later of (x)&nbsp;the date on which the entire principal amount of the 4.0% Notes Due 2019 ceases to be outstanding, and (y)&nbsp;the date on which the entire principal amount of any additional convertible securities that the Company has in writing consented to permit the ADS Borrower to hedge under the Share Lending Agreement ceases to be outstanding, in each case, whether as a result of conversion, redemption, repurchase, cancellation or otherwise; and (c)&nbsp;the termination of the Share Lending Agreement. The Company is not required to make any payment to the initial purchasers or ADS Borrower upon the return of the Loaned Shares. The ADS Borrowers do not have the choice or option to pay cash in exchange for the return of the Loaned Shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	No collateral is required to be posted for the Loaned Share.
</FONT>
	The initial purchasers are required to remit to the Company any dividends paid to the holders of the Loaned Shares. An ADS Borrower has the ability to vote without restriction. However, the ADS Borrowers have agreed not to vote on the Loaned Shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In accordance with
</FONT>
	FASB ASC Sub-topic 470-20, the Company has accounted for the Share Lending Agreement at fair value and recognized it as an issuance cost associated with the convertible debt offering. As a result, additional debt issuance costs of $3,092,580 were recorded on the issuance date with a corresponding increase to additional paid-in capital. The debt issuance costs are amortized to October&nbsp;15, 2017, the repurchase date, using the effective interest method. Amortization expense for the issuance costs were $140,984 and $999,721 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the unamortized amount of the issuance costs associated with the Share Lending Arrangement was $2,951,596 and $1,951,875, respectively, and the fair value of the Share Lending Agreement was $3,092,580 and $ 1,939,820, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In accordance with ASC Topic 470-20, although legally issued, the
</FONT>
	Loaned Shares are excluded from basic and diluted earnings per share unless default of the Share-Lending Arrangement occurs, at which time the Loaned Shares would be included in the basic and diluted earnings per share calculation. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, it is not probable that the ADS Borrower or the counterparty to the Share-Lending Arrangement will default.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1
</FONT>
	2.
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1
</FONT>
	3. ORDINARY SHARES
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In June&nbsp;2014, the Company issued in aggregate 10,120,000 ADSs, representing 506,000,000 ordinary shares, in a registered offering. The net proceeds from the offering was $106,177,882, after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions and other issuance costs of $5,142,118.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In October&nbsp;2014, the Company issued in aggregate 2,504,000 ADSs, representing 125,200,000 ordinary shares, in a registered offering. The net proceeds from the offering was $26,235,928, after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions and other issuance costs of $3,186,072.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	33
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_33_191115_2897">
</A>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1
</FONT>
	4.&#160; SHARE-BASED COMPENSATION
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company measures share-based compensation cost on the grant date at the fair value of the award and recognizes this cost as an expense on straight-line
</FONT>
	basis over the grant recipients&#146; requisite service period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Restricted Shares
</FONT>
</U>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In July&nbsp;2006, the Company adopted the Share Incentive Plan (the &#147;Share Incentive Plan&#148;) upon which the Compensation Committee (the &#147;Committee&#148;) of the
</FONT>
	Board of Directors can authorize to make awards of Restricted Shares to any participant selected by the Committee in such amounts under terms and conditions as determined by the Committee. Restricted Shares shall be subject to restrictions on transferability and other restrictions as the Committee may impose (including, without limitation, limitations on the right to vote Restricted Shares or the right to receive dividends on the Restricted Share). These restrictions may lapse separately or in combination at such times, pursuant to such circumstances, in such installments, or otherwise, as the Committee determines at the time of the grant of the Award or thereafter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For restricted shares granted during 2008 and 2014, 15%, 15%, 20%, 25% and 25% of the restricted shares shall vest at the first, second, third, fourth and fifth anniversary of the grant date, respectively. For restricted shares granted in 2015, 20%, 20%, 20%, 20% and 20% of the restricted shares shall vest at the first, second, third, fourth and fifth anniversary of the grant date, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	34
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_34_191328_3020">
</A>
</P>

	56,187,133

</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.62%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.18%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:11.4%;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	0.19
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.04%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The fair value of the restricted shares was based on the quoted market price of the Company&#146;s shares on the date of grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	5 there was $10,475,820 of total unrecognized compensation cost related to unvested restricted shares, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 3.70 years. The total fair value of shares vested during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014, and 2015 was $1,266,440, $2,531,384 and $2,668,946 respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Share Options
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In May&nbsp;2008, the Company revised the Share Incentive Plan and introduced stock options as a compensation instrument to its employees. Under the terms of
</FONT>
	the revised Share Incentive Plan, share options are granted to employees at exercise prices equal to the Company&#146;s share price on the grant date. The Company&#146;s stock options expire five years from their grant date and generally vest one third per annum on the anniversary of the grant date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During 201
</FONT>
	3, 2014 and 2015, the Company granted 53,599,950, 36,897,900 and 17,750,100 share options, respectively, to its board of directors and employees. Those share options will vest one third per annum on the anniversary of the grant date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	35
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_35_191531_7748">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

	Total intrinsic value of options exercised for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	3, 2014 and 2015 were $1,041,126, $2,688,889 and $1,676,174 respectively. The weighted-average grant date fair value of options granted during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 was $0.09, $0.11 and $0.14 respectively, computed using the Black-Scholes-Merton closed-form option valuation model and using the following weighted average assumptions:

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company estimated the expected term, which represents its best estimate of the period of time from the grant date that it expects the stock options to remain outstanding, using the simplified method. Under this method, the Company estimates the expected term of its stock options as the mid-point between their time to vest and their contractual term. The Company applied the simplified method because it does not have sufficient historical exercise data to provide a reasonable basis upon which to estimate expected term due to the limited period of time that has elapsed since its first option grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company estimated the expected volatility based upon historical volatility of its own stock price. The Company used U.S. Treasury rates in effect at the time of the grants for the risk-free rate of return.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	5, the Company had $3,237,630 of unrecognized share-based compensation cost related to unvested share options, which it expects to recognize over a weighted-average period of 1.68 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>

</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1
</FONT>
	5.&#160; INCOME TAXES
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cayman Islands
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under the current laws of the Cayman Islands, the Company is not subject to tax on income or capital gain.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Hong Kong
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s fully-owned subsidiary, Trina Solar (Hong Kong) Enterprise Limited (&#147;THK&#148;) was subject to Hong Kong profit tax at a rate of 16.5% in 201
</FONT>
	3, 2014 and 2015. No Hong Kong profit tax has been provided as THK has not had assessable profit that was earned in or derived from Hong Kong during the years presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Singapore
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s fully-owned subsidiary, Trina Solar Singapore Pte. Ltd. (&#147;TSI&#148;)
</FONT>
	was subject to Singapore profit tax at a rate of 17% in 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively.&#160; In addition, the Company&#146;s fully-owned subsidiary, Trina Solar Energy Development Pte. Ltd. (&#147;TED&#148;) was subject to a preferential Singapore profit tax at an effective rate of 5% in 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	United States
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s subsidiaries incorporated in the United States were subject to United States income tax at a combined federal and state tax rate of 40% in 201
</FONT>
	3, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Japan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s fully-owned subsidiary, Trina Solar (Japan) Limited (&#147;TJP&#148;) was subject to Japan profit tax at a rate of 40% in 201
</FONT>
	3, 41% in 2014 and 40% in 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	Germany
</FONT>
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s fully owned subsidiary, Trina Solar (Germany) GmbH (&#147;TGM&#148;) was subject to Germany profit tax at a rate of 32.9% in 2013 and a rate of 27.38% in 2014
</FONT>
	and 2015, respectively.
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage172"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1
</FONT>
	5.&#160; INCOME TAXES &#151; continued
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PRC
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under PRC&#146;s Enterprise Income Tax Law (&#147;EIT Law&#148;), the statutory income tax rate is 25%, and the EIT rate shall be reduced to 15% for state-encouraged High and New Technology Enterprises (&#147;HNTE&#148;). HNTE is valid for three years from the date of authorization. The Company&#146;s PRC subsidiaries are subject to income tax at 25%, unless otherwise specified. Trina China first obtained a HNTE certificate in 2008 and began to enjoy the preferential tax rate. In 2014, Trina China renewed the HNTE certificate and therefore currently is subject to income tax rate at 15% from 2014 to 2016.&#160; TST obtained a HNTE certificate in 2011 and began to enjoy the preferential tax rate. In 2014, TST renewed the HNTE certificate and therefore is subject to income tax rate at 15% from 2014 to 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	According to the PRC Tax Administration and Collection Law, the statute of limitations is three years if the underpayment of income taxes is due to computational errors made by the taxpayer. The statute of limitations will be extended to five years under special circumstances, which are not clearly defined, but an underpayment of income tax liability exceeding RMB100,000 ($
</FONT>
	15,399) is specifically listed as a special circumstance. In the case of a transfer pricing related adjustment, the statute of limitations is ten years. There is no statute of limitations in the case of tax evasion. The Company&#146;s PRC subsidiaries are therefore subject to examination by the PRC tax authorities from 2010 through 2015 on non-transfer pricing matters, and from 2005 through 2015 on transfer pricing matters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of January&nbsp;1, 2015 and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company has no
</FONT>
	significant unrecognized tax benefits relating to uncertain tax positions. Also, the Company does not expect that the amount of unrecognized tax benefits will increase significantly within the next 12 months.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The operating results before income tax and the provision for income taxes by tax jurisdictions for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	3, 2014 and 2015 is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="11%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:11.98%;">

	19,250,271
</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.48%;">

	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:11.98%;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	40,363,192
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In assessing the realizability of deferred income tax assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred income tax assets will not be realized. As of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	5, the valuation allowance of $40,363,192 was related to the deferred income tax assets of certain Company&#146;s subsidiaries in Europe, United States and Japan.&#160; The increase in the valuation allowance during 2015 was primarily due to valuation allowance provided on the deferred income tax assets of the Company&#146;s subsidiaries in United States due to losses incurred by these entities resulting from anti-dumping and anti-subsidy duties.&#160; The ultimate realization of deferred income tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income during the periods in which those temporary differences become deductible or utilized. Management considers the scheduled reversal of deferred income tax liability, projected future taxable income and tax planning strategies in making this assessment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Based upon the level of historical taxable income and projections for future taxable income over the periods in which the deferred income tax assets are deductible or can be utilized, management believes it is more likely than not that the deferred tax asset, net of the valuation allowance as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	5, will be realized. However, the amount of the deferred tax assets considered realizable could be reduced in the near term if estimates of future taxable income during the carryforward period are reduced.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During 2014, valuation allowance for deferred tax assets on net operating losses (&#147;NOL&#148;) of $27,407,428 were reversed as those NOLs were utilized by the respective subsidiaries.&#160; In addition, management has reversed valuation allowance for deferred income tax assets of these subsidiaries by $5,617,066 based upon the estimated generation of future taxable income during the periods in which the underlying temporary differences become deductible or utilized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The net operating losses carryforwards of the Company&#146;s PRC subsidiaries amounted to $ 3,116,878 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, of which $1,315,511 and 1,801,367 will expire if unused by December&nbsp;31, 2019 and 2020, respectively. The net operating losses carryforwards of the Company&#146;s subsidiary in Switzerland amounted to $135,450,307 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, of which $40,660,540, $76,829,178, $5,718,159
</FONT>
	, $1,158,554 and $11,083,815 will expire if unused by December&nbsp;31, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The EIT law and its relevant regulations impose a withholding tax at 10%, unless reduced by a tax treaty or agreement, for dividends distributed by a PRC- resident enterprise to its non-PRC-resident corporate investor for earnings generated beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2008. Undistributed earnings generated prior to January&nbsp;1, 2008 are exempt from such withholding tax. The Company has not recognized a deferred tax liability of $
</FONT>
	53.7 million for the undistributed earnings of approximately $537.1 million of the PRC-resident enterprise as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, as the Company plans to reinvest these earnings indefinitely in the PRC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company has considered temporary differences on the book to tax differences pertaining to all investment in subsidiaries including the determination of the indefinite reinvestment assertion that would apply to each foreign subsidiary. The Company evaluated each entity&#146;s historical, current business environment and plans to indefinitely reinvest all earnings accumulated in its respective jurisdiction for purpose of future business expansion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company has not recognized a deferred tax liability of $53.7 million for the undistributed earnings of approximately $537.1 million of the PRC-resident enterprise as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, as the Company plans to reinvest these earnings indefinitely in the PRC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	16
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;&#160; DISTRIBUTION OF PROFIT
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Pursuant to the law of the PRC on enterprises with Wholly Owned Foreign Investment, the Company&#146;s subsidiaries in the PRC are required to allocate at least 10% of their after tax profits, after making good of accumulated losses as reported in their PRC statutory financial statements, to the general reserve fund and have the right to discontinue allocations to the general reserve fund if the balance of such reserve has reached 50% of their registered capital. The general reserves are not available for distribution to the shareholders (except in liquidation) and may not be transferred in the form of loans, advances, or cash dividend.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As a result of these PRC laws and regulations, the Company&#146;s subsidiary in the PRC is restricted in its ability to transfer the registered capital and general reserve fund to Trina in the form of dividends, loans or advances and the restricted portion amounted to $926,953,793 and $1,203,486,652 as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	4 and 2015, respectively, including non-distributable general reserve fund of $49,713,298 and $58,634,694 as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The amount that is not subject to restrictions, and which may be transferred from the Company&#146;s subsidiaries in the PRC in the form of dividends, loans or advances, is $213,269,385 and $468,338,971 as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	4 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F -
</FONT>
	41
<A NAME="A16-1508_120F_HTM_PB_41_175858_3020">
</A>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TRINA SOLAR LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1
</FONT>
	7.&#160;&#160;&#160; RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS AND BALANCES
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Related party balances
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the amounts due from related parties of $13,374,246 and $13,485,381, respectively, represent receivables from Changzhou Jiuling New Energy S&amp;T Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;Jiuling&#148;), an entity controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Weizhong Wu, who is the brother in law of Mr.&nbsp;Jifan Gao, Trina&#146;s CEO. The receivables arose from the Company&#146;s sales of solar module to Jiuling. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company has collected all outstanding receivables from Jiuling.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, advance to related parties of $6,112,110 and $1,878,773, respectively, represents the prepayment to Changzhou Youze S&amp;T CO.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;Youze&#148;), an entity controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Weizhong Wu, for wafer slicing service to be delivered in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the amounts due to related parties of $8,088,550 and $17,528,730, respectively, include payable to Youze arising from the Company&#146;s purchase of wafers, payable due to Jiuling, arising from the Company&#146;s purchase of wafers, packing materials and spare parts, payable due to Changzhou Hesai Photovoltaic Materials Co. Ltd. (&#147;Hesai&#148;) arising from the Company&#146;s purchase of tinned ribbons, payable due to Changzhou Youze Hezhong Photoelectric Co Ltd (&#147;Hezhong&#148;) arising from the Company&#146;s purchase of processing materials and payable due to Changzhou Junhe Mechanical Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;Junhe&#148;) arising from the Company&#146;s purchase of cleansers and equipment maintenance service. Junhe is an entity controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Weifeng Wu, who is the brother in law of Mr.&nbsp;Jifan Gao, Trina&#146;s CEO. Hezhong is an entity held by Mr.&nbsp;Weizhong Wu, Mr.&nbsp;Weifeng Wu and Ms Chunyan Wu, who
</FONT>
</FONT>
	is the wife of Mr.&nbsp;Jifan Gao. Hesai is an entity controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Jifan Gao, Trina&#146;s CEO and his wife.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Related party transactions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2013, 2014 and 2015, the Company purchased wafers for a total price of RMB 89,207,627 ($14,450,766), RMB 24,974,373 ($4,068,502) and RMB 55,536,476 ($8,915,133), respectively, from Youze. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2014 and 2015, the Company purchased wafers, cells and other materials for a total price of RMB 13,857,069 ($2,252,473) and RMB 10,901,676 ($1,678,834), respectively, from Jiuling. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2015, the Company purchased other materials for a total price of RMB 61,454,081 ($9,463,792) from Hesai, Junhe and Hezhong. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2013, 2014 and 2015, the Company sold ingots for a total price of RMB 23,440,335 ($3,762,160), nil and nil, respectively, to Youze. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2014 and 2015, the Company sold modules for a total price of RMB 104,770,386 ($17,066,614) and RMB 267,300,928 ($42,860,016), respectively, to Jiuling. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2015, the Company sold wafers and polysilicons for a total price of RMB 9,340,814 ($1,507,741) to Jiuling, Youze and Jiangsu Trina Solar Storage Co. Ltd.&#160; Jiangsu Trina Solar Storage Co. Ltd. is an entity controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Jifan Gao. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2015, the Company sold modules for a total price of JPY 211,309,545 ($1,736,171) to AHT Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., an entity controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Weizhong Wu. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2013, 2014 and 2015, the Company incurred costs of RMB 200,985,124 ($32,322,658), RMB 244,434,301 ($39,766,273) and RMB 304,977,367 ($49,139,874) with respect to the wafer slicing service provided by Youze. In 2014, the Company entered into a long-term agreement with Youze for the wafer slicing service from July&nbsp;2014 to June&nbsp;2016 and made a prepayment of RMB 50,000,000 ($8,126,381). The prepayment balance was RMB 37,400,000 ($ 6,112,110) and RMB 12,200,000 ($1,878,773), respectively, as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2013, 2014 and 2015, the Company received equipment maintenance services for a total price of RMB 3,029,559 ($487,808), RMB 2,744,009 ($446,844) and RMB 2,766,398 ($426,019) from Junhe. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2015, the Company received logistics and shipping services of RMB 18,575,387 ($2,945,529) from Jiangsu Youze International Logistics Co., Ltd, an entity controlled by Mr. Weizhong Wu. The transactions were approved by the audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company believes the prices paid for products or services provided by related parties approximate the purchase price paid to third party vendors and the sale price of the products sold to the related parties were at prices similar to the sales price sold to third party customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
